definition: a dam placed in a watercourse to increase the depth of water or to divert it into a channel for navigation or irrigation
artillery fire laid on a line (see line entry 1 sense 6c) close to friendly troops to screen and protect them
examples: The enemy laid down a barrage of machine-gun fire as our platoon approached the bridge.

definition: a vigorous or rapid outpouring or projection of many things at once
to deliver a barrage (see barrage entry 2) against
examples: being barraged by campaign ads before the election
